alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 7:21AM EDT until August 16 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL MONROE COUNTY... At 721 AM EDT, Rainfall has ended across the area, but excessive runoff from heavy rain overnight will continue to cause flooding early this morning. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing in some portions of the city. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, Hilton, Brighton, Gates-North Gates, Charlotte, Braddock Bay and Rochester General Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
